text_en: 248 Substance-Related and Addictive Disorders period of 12 months or longer (with the exception that Criterion A4, “Craving, or a strong desire or urge to use the hallucinogen,” may be met). Specify if: In a controlled environment: This additional specifier is used if the individual is in an environment where access to hallucino- gens is restricted. Coding based on current severity: Note for ICD-10-CM codes: If a hallucinogen intoxication or another hallucinogen-induced mental disorder is also present, do not use the codes below for hallucinogen use disorder. Instead, the comorbid hallucinogen use disorder is in- dicated in the 4th character of the hallucinogen-induced disorder code (see the coding note for hallucinogen intoxication or a specific hallucinogen-induced mental disorder). For example, if there is co- morbid hallucinogen-induced psychotic disorder and hallucinogen use disorder, only the hallucinogen-induced psychotic disorder code is given, with the 4th character indicating whether the comorbid hal- lucinogen use disorder is mild, moderate, or severe: F16.159 for mild hallucinogen use disorder with hallucinogen-induced psychotic disor- der or F16.259 for a moderate or severe hallucinogen use disorder with hallucinogen-induced psychotic disorder.
